ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned how to critically evaluate discussion through proper Hindi writing and terminology.
Developed Hindi language skills and discussed important cultural issues in the south asian community
I learned to speak Hindi much better, as well as understand it!
Excellent Hindi skills, got way more confident in my speaking and learned a lot of vocab which I use frequently so thats awesome
I learned the devanagri script, how to write better, and how to read better. I also became a better communicator/debator in the Hindi language.
I learned Hindi grammar and vocab and the Devnagari script
Absolutely loved Hindi with Mansi-ji. Super fun and super understanding!!
Hindi vocabulary, grammar, speaking, and writing skills, and differences in Indian culture compared to American culture in media and thinking
How to read and write Hindi.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course has few weaknesses. The teacher is extremely kind and helps you learn the language throughout.
It was a well developed course that balanced discussion and traditional instruction. Quizzes felt forced and unnecessary.
Only strengths. This was one of the most memorable classes I've taken because of the amazing community we fostered. Thank you so much, Mansi Ji!

Weaknesses were the other students in the class who sometimes said dumb stuff LOL, but the class was very well organized and I liked the curriculum. I do think it sometimes felt like the advanced nature of the concepts we were being asked to speak about were slightly beyond our speaking ability.
The main strength of the course is a supportive instructor and an engaging community. I never dreaded going to class, and it was one of my favorite experiences at yale.
It's a good way to practice what I already know and become more familiar with the language but I did not learn much new vocab.

strengths were the reflections were a good way practice writing Hindi and using newly learned vocabulary and grammar while applying these skills to interesting writing topics, class discussions were interesting and engaging, quizzes were graded not too harshly
none

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. This course provides many with the opportunity to understand their heritage language.
Yes, it is an excellent course that builds community while developing language skills
Yes if you are looking for a fun and constructive class, take it!

Absolutely! Loved learning with Mansi Ji and its a great community where you get to have a lot of fun events and gain a lot of practice speaking Hindi. I also met some of my best friends in the class.
If you speak hindi/urdu at home and you want to learn the script to read/write this is a fantastic course. No need for any prior knowledge.
Yes, anyone who wants a good place to practice speaking and writing Hindi.
Take it!!!
yes, class was interesting and engaging, instructor teaches well and engages students, many Hindi skills are learned, and class is fun
Yes, if you want to learn hindi!
